description: This trap indicates a server module redundancy switchover has occurred.
The standby server module in the specified shelf and slot has become
active. The previous active slot, switchover reason, and group
information are included.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD SONUS-REDUNDANCY-SERVICES-MIB::sonusRedundGroupSwitchOverNotification SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusShelfIndex i 1 SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusSlotIndex i 1 SONUS-REDUNDANCY-SERVICES-MIB::sonusRedundPrevActiveSlotIndex i 1 SONUS-REDUNDANCY-SERVICES-MIB::sonusRedundGroupLastSwitchoverReason i 1 SONUS-REDUNDANCY-SERVICES-MIB::sonusRedundGroupName s EXAMPLE SONUS-REDUNDANCY-SERVICES-MIB::sonusRedundGroupAdmnIndex i 9999 SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusEventDescription s EXAMPLE SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusEventClass i 1 SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusEventLevel i 1

description: The shelf index of the event that generated the trap.
variables.name: SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusShelfIndex

description: The slot index of the event that generated the trap.
variables.name: SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusSlotIndex

description: The slot index of the failed server module whose switchover generated
this trap.
variables.name: SONUS-REDUNDANCY-SERVICES-MIB::sonusRedundPrevActiveSlotIndex

description: Reason for the last switchover in this redundancy group.
variables.name: SONUS-REDUNDANCY-SERVICES-MIB::sonusRedundGroupLastSwitchoverReason

description: The name of this redundancy group instance.
variables.name: SONUS-REDUNDANCY-SERVICES-MIB::sonusRedundGroupName

description: Identifies the target redundancy group entry.
variables.name: SONUS-REDUNDANCY-SERVICES-MIB::sonusRedundGroupAdmnIndex

description: A description of the event that generated the trap.

description: The category of the event that generated the trap.
variables.name: SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusEventClass

description: The severity level of the event that generated the trap.
variables.name: SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusEventLevel

description: This trap indicates that the specified redundancy group has
no redundancy protection.

description: This trap indicates that the specified redundancy group has
full redundancy protection.

description: This trap indicates that the specified redundancy group's protected
client slot has been restored and is synchronized to the currently
active redundant module. For Nx1 redundancy groups, a revertive
switchover is recommended to restore full redundancy protection to
the group.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD SONUS-REDUNDANCY-SERVICES-MIB::sonusRedundGroupProtectedClientRestored SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusShelfIndex i 1 SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusSlotIndex i 1 SONUS-REDUNDANCY-SERVICES-MIB::sonusRedundGroupName s EXAMPLE SONUS-REDUNDANCY-SERVICES-MIB::sonusRedundGroupAdmnIndex i 9999 SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusEventDescription s EXAMPLE SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusEventClass i 1 SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusEventLevel i 4
